org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine
Class AeBpelEngine

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeBusinessProcessEngine
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.AeAbstractServerEngine
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.AeBpelEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeBusinessProcessEngine, IAeBusinessProcessEngineCallback, IAeBusinessProcessEngineInternal, IAeBusinessProcessFactory
public class AeBpelEngine
extends AeAbstractServerEngine

The runtime BPEL engine. There are only minor differences between the runtime engine and the simulation engine. This is because most of the behavioral differences are encapsulated in interfaces.

Nested Class Summary
private static class AeBpelEngine.AeDispatchReceiveRunnableHelper
          Helper class for executing the call to dispatch receive asynchronously Note: This class is now declared as static and Serializable (via IAeInputMessageWork) to support customers who may want to transfer input message work items from one machine to another.
private static class AeBpelEngine.AeProcessExecutionRunnableHelper
          Helper class for asynchronous process execution Note: This class is now declared as static and Serializable (via IAeInputMessageWork) to support customers who may want to transfer input message work items from one machine to another.
protected static class AeBpelEngine.AeServerPartnerLinkStrategy
          Implements the partner link strategy for the server business process engine.

doMultiStartCreateProcessWithMessage

protected long doMultiStartCreateProcessWithMessage(AeInboundReceive aInboundReceive,
                                                    IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback,
                                                    boolean aQueueForExecution)
                                             throws AeBusinessProcessException
Handles the special case of creating a multi-start process. Such a process can be created with the arrival of data for more than one activity. The spec requires these activities to be correlated with the same correlation sets. By the time we've reached this method, we've already determined that there is no existing process that is waiting for the receipt of this data and as such we've decided to create a new one. However, due to the concurrent nature of the engine, we need to synchronize here in order to prevent two processes from being created with the same correlated data.

Parameters:
aInboundReceive -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

calculateCorrelationHash

protected int calculateCorrelationHash(java.util.Map aCorrelationMap)
Given a correlation map, this method calculates a hash value for the data in the map.

Parameters:
aCorrelationMap - The correlation map.
Returns:
